title: Feature to see what RDP sessions have been disconnected
author: Caspar035
body_snippet:
So sometimes I have like 10 RDP sessions open using mRemoteNG. However when we temporary lose internet connection for a longer time the RDP sessions will retry connecting but after a while they will be disconnected and I am not able to see what RDP sessions I had opened up.

## Expected Behavior
I would like to see what RDP sessions have been disconnected because it will not show you which ones you had opened up.

## Current Behavior
At this moment after longer period of losing connectivit...

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
Would it also work if we didn't close the tab that the connection was being shown in? That way the Reconnect and Reconnect All functionality could be used for reestablishing those lost connections.

This is already how the putty (SSH) sessions function, but I think it would still require some extra work for the RDP sessions to get that as well.

comments.author: Caspar035
comments.snippet:
Hi There, thanks for the reply

I think it would work just fine, as long as the tabs remain opened up you could reconnect them. Would be an awesome feature, also for laptops that use it on the go and lose connectivity more often due to WIFI or moving to a different location.

comments.author: farosch

comments.author: joelsplace
comments.snippet: I know this is old but the answer isn't really the same thing as what was asked for or at least it doesn't address my needs.  I work at a client once a week.  During the week other people RDP to servers and it kicks me out.  I don't want it to automatically try to reconnect since someone else is using the servers but I want the tabs open when I come in so I know what servers I was working on and can easily reconnect.  I guess the auto reconnect might cover that but it doesn't seem like it would....

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet: @joelsplace It does cover that. Just take a look at my screenshot or try it out yourself.
